questions.question: I am not surprised that she doesn't have any friends. She is as sour as ..............................
questions.description: If a person is as sour as vinegar, they are very disagreeable.

questions.question: She has so many friends because she is as sweet as ................................
questions.description: If you are as sweet as honey, you are a very sweet person.

questions.question: I don't have a sweet ......................... I rarely eat desserts.
questions.description: To have a sweet tooth is to have a love for sugary foods.

questions.question: I appreciate his integrity and honesty. He is a .............................. of the earth type person.
questions.description: This is an expression used to refer to sincere and decent people.

questions.question: His latest book is selling like .................................
questions.description: If something sells like hotcakes, it sells quickly.

questions.question: You should have just told me the truth. There was no need to ............................... it.
questions.description: To sugarcoat is to present bad news in such a way that it sounds less unpleasant.

questions.question: Take every piece of news you find online with a grain of ...............................
questions.description: To take something with a pinch of salt is to view it with some skepticism.

questions.question: It is time he proved that he is worth his ...............................
questions.description: When you are worth your salt you are competent at what you do.

questions.question: She was the .................................. of her mother's eye.
In the end his hard work bore .................................... and he became a successful musician.
questions.description: To bear fruit is to get favorable results.

questions.question: The car won't start again. I think I bought a ...............................
questions.description: To buy a lemon is to buy something worthless.

questions.question: Don't compare a race car with a tiny hatchback. That is like comparing apples to ................................
questions.description: To compare apples to oranges is to compare things that are totally different.
